titles.title: Terrorist Rewards Enhancement Act
Terrorist Rewards Enhancement Act
To permit eligibility in certain circumstances for an officer or employee of a foreign government to receive a reward under the Department of State Rewards Program.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on International Relations.
Ms. Ros-Lehtinen moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill.
Considered under suspension of the rules.
DEBATE - The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 2329.

vote.text: On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill Agreed to by voice vote.

action.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
Read twice and referred to the Committee on Foreign Relations.

bill.summary: Terrorist Rewards Enhancement Act - Amends the State Department Basic Authorities Act of 1956 to authorize the Secretary of State, in certain circumstances, to pay a reward under the Department of State Rewards Program to an officer or employee of a foreign government (or entity thereof) for furnishing information that assists in the prevention of acts of international terrorism, international narcotics trafficking, and other related criminal acts.
